conclusion: The coil is a square with side length L. It has N turns. The coil is in a uniform magnetic field B. The coil rotates with angular velocity Ï‰ around an axis perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The induced EMF in a coil rotating in a magnetic field is given by: ğ“” = N B A Ï‰ sin(Ï‰ t).
N is the number of turns. B is the magnetic field strength. A is the area of the coil. Ï‰ is the angular velocity. sin(Ï‰ t) accounts for the rotation.
The area A of the square coil is: A = L^2.

premise: The maximum induced EMF occurs when sin(Ï‰ t) = 1.
conclusion: The maximum induced EMF is: ğ“”_max = N B L^2 Ï‰.

premise: The effective value of the induced EMF is given by: ğ“”_eff = ğ“”_max / âˆš2.
conclusion: Substitute the maximum EMF into the effective value formula: ğ“”_eff = N B L^2 Ï‰ / âˆš2.

premise: The effective value of the induced EMF is ğ“”_eff = N B L^2 Ï‰ / âˆš2.
conclusion: The effective value of the induced electromotive force in the coil is: ğ“”_eff = (âˆš2/2) N B L^2 Ï‰.
